action.action-desc: Mr. Garbarino (for himself, Ms. Castor of Florida, Mr. Fitzpatrick, and Ms. Chu) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare coverage for individuals with metastatic breast cancer, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Metastatic Breast Cancer Access to Care Act.

section.header: Elimination of waiting period for individuals with metastatic breast cancer

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to applications for disability insurance benefits filed after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Waiver of 24-month waiting period for Medicare coverage of individuals with metastatic breast cancer

subsection.text: Section 226(h) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 426(h)) is amended by inserting or metastatic breast cancer after amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to benefits for months beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
